intro: Cunila leucantha, commonly known as white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters. Cunila leucantha is not widely cultivated but is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
